details:
Various vulnerabilities were fixed in nss,
the Network Security Service libraries.


* [CVE-2018-12404](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12404)
Cache side-channel variant of the Bleichenbacher attack.
* [CVE-2018-18508](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18508)
NULL pointer dereference in several CMS functions
 resulting in a denial of service.
* [CVE-2019-11719](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-11719)
Out-of-bounds read when importing curve25519 private key.
* [CVE-2019-11729](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-11729)
Empty or malformed p256-ECDH public keys may
 trigger a segmentation fault.
* [CVE-2019-11745](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-11745)
Out-of-bounds write when encrypting with a block cipher.
* [CVE-2019-17006](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-17006)
Some cryptographic primitives did not check the
 length of the input text, potentially resulting in overflows.
* [CVE-2019-17007](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-17007)
Handling of Netscape Certificate Sequences may crash with a NULL
 dereference leading to a denial of service.
* [CVE-2020-12399](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-12399)
Force a fixed length for DSA exponentiation.
* [CVE-2020-6829](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6829)* [CVE-2020-12400](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-12400)
Side channel attack on ECDSA signature generation.
* [CVE-2020-12401](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-12401)
ECDSA timing attack mitigation bypass.
* [CVE-2020-12402](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-12402)
Side channel vulnerabilities during RSA key generation.
* [CVE-2020-12403](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-12403)
CHACHA20-POLY1305 decryption with undersized tag leads to
 out-of-bounds read.


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
2:3.26.2-1.1+deb9u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your nss packages.


For the detailed security status of nss please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/nss>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
